results.title: Not a love story
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Dorothy Todd Henaut and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A thought provoking chronicle of the odyssey of two women motivated by the desire to know more about pornography - why it exists, the forms it takes and how it affects the relations between men and women. It offers insights and perspective’s from men and women who earn their living from the porn trade, and from some of pornography’s most outspoken critics.

results.title: Tread softly
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Di Drew and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Claire (Robyn Nevin) and Angela (Natalie Bate) have only been been living together for a short time but Claire’s constant attention has already become suffocating to Angela. She needs space and time to be alone.
The painful final stages of an affair that is over but not yet finished.

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Richard Wherrett and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Regarded as one of Australia’s acclaimed theatre and artistic directors, Richard Wherrett has transformed his directing skills into film with this adaptation of “The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris. Cast includes Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Judy Morris, Anna Volska and John Clayton. Director of Photography, Geoff Burton.

results.title: El Salvador: another Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Tete Vasconcellos, Glenn Silber and Catalyst Media Productions
results.brief_description: Investigates the history of the crises and the forces that have embroiled the United States in this Central American conflict. The film follows the sad history of El Salvador from fifty years of dictatorship, through the civilian-military junta of 1979 and a growing dependency on American aid. Narrated by Mike Farrell.

results.title: Audacious
results.creator_credit: Fiona Tuomy, Samantha Lang and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Stella, a young woman bored with her husband’s bedroom behaviour, embarks on a daring journey to the other side of sexual satisfaction.
Cast features Dee Smart as Stella and John Polson as Tom.

results.title: Union maids
results.creator_credit: James Klein, New Day Films, Miles Mogulescu and Julia Reichert
results.brief_description: A stirring history of three women’s experience in labor organisation in Chicago in the 1930’s, told through interviews, interspersed with archival newsreels and period photographs of stop-work meetings, working conditions, picket lines and fights with the police. Raises issues surrounding sexism and racism in union organising. The three women are Kate Hyndman, Stella Nowicki and Sylvia Woods. Based on the book entitled “Rank and File” by Alice Lynd.

results.title: Vietnam requiem
results.creator_credit: Jonas McCord, Bill Couturie and Else, Couturie and Korty
results.brief_description: Five men, each decorated for valor in Vietnam, are interviewed from prison where they are now serving time for crimes committed since their return from the war. Focuses particularly on Albert Dobbs, showing family photos and newsreel footage, and presenting his recollections as well as those of his family and a fellow soldier. Expresses the self-destructive forces set in motion by the horror of war and disillusioning homecomings. Narrated by Peter Thomas.

results.title: Stagecoach
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Walter Wanger and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the story “Stage to Lordsburg” by Ernest Haycox. Passengers on a stagecoach heading for Lordsburg, New Mexico have a rough trip, during which Curly, the sheriff who is riding shotgun, arrests the Ringo Kid (John Wayne), who has broken out of prison to shoot it out with the Plummer brothers. Enroute, one passenger, a young officer’s wife, gives birth, with the aid of the Dr. Boone, an alcoholic and Dallas, a beautiful woman of questionable repute. Shortly thereafter, the stagecoach is attacked by Apaches. When they finally arrive in Lordsburg, Curly allows Ringo to settle his dispute, and make a getaway with Dallas, with whom he has fallen in love.

results.title: Double indemnity (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Joseph Sistrom, Paramount Pictures and Billy Wilder
results.brief_description: Archetypal film noir of the forties, brilliantly filmed and incisively written by Billy Wilder and Raymond Chandler, perfectly capturing the decayed Los Angeles atmosphere of a Chandler novel but using a simpler story and more substantial characters. The hero/villain was almost a new concept. Stars Fred MacMurray, Barbara Stanwyck and Edward G. Robinson. Based on a novel by James M. Cain.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Sistrom, Paramount Pictures and Billy Wilder

results.title: Psycho (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Paramount Pictures and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s macabre masterpiece broke all of the existing rules for horror films and filmmakers, set the standard for a generation of new ones and kept uncounted masses wary of entering showers. It remains a benchmark for the technique of audience manipulation. Undoubtedly Hitchcock’s most calculated work, he was ably supported by the extraordinary leading performances of Anthony Perkins as the psychotic motel owner and Janet Leigh as the hapless thief, reinforced by Bernard Herman’s evocatively dissonant musical score. Based on the novel by Robert Bloch.
